org.dinopolis.gpstool
Class GPSTool

java.lang.Object
  org.dinopolis.gpstool.GPSTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, ProgressListener, PropertyChangeListener
public class GPSTool
extends Object
implements PropertyChangeListener, ProgressListener

Demo application to show the usage of the org.dinopolis.gpstool.gpsinput package (read and interpret gps data from various devices (serial, file, ...).

It uses a velocity (http://jakarta.apache.org/velocity) template to print the downloaded tracks, routes, and waypoints. See the help output for details about the usable variables.

Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Christof Dallermassl, Stefan Feitl

printTemplate

public boolean printTemplate(org.apache.velocity.VelocityContext context,
                             Reader template,
                             Writer out)
                      throws IOException
Prints the given context with the given velocity template to the given output writer.

Parameters:
context - the velocity context holding all the data
template - the reader providing the template to use
out - the writer to write the result to.
Returns:
true if successfull, false otherwise (see velocity log for details then).
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs

                        int min_value,
                        int max_value)
Callback to inform listeners about an action to start.

Specified by:
actionStart in interface ProgressListener
Parameters:
action_id - the id of the action that is started. This id may be used to display a message for the user.
min_value - the minimum value of the progress counter.
max_value - the maximum value of the progress counter. If the max value is unknown, max_value is set to Integer.NaN.

actionProgress

public void actionProgress(String action_id,
                           int current_value)
Callback to inform listeners about progress going on. It is not guaranteed that this method is called on every change of current value (e.g. only call this method on every 10th change).

Specified by:

Parameters:
action_id - the id of the action that is started. This id may be used to display a message for the user.
